function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited generalizability of research results","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of communication and employee well-being considerations","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on infrastructure projects and staff members","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty conducting drugs and alcohol tests for new staff","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prevalence of covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential economic collapse","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unanimous implementation of solutions not achieved in organisations a and c","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited work from home periods for employees during lockdown","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for unexpected outbreaks such as covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Construction workers being exposed to the virus due to close contact and shared workspaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited availability of virus testing for workers within the uk","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in adjusting commercial terms and place of work requirements to comply with safety obligations","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing in site offices and vans","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in supply chain and accommodation provision for construction workers","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Hiring new staff members during a pandemic without in-person interviews and induction process.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on digital tools and remote work may lead to decreased attention to health and safety protocols on site, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of new staff into the organization may pose a risk of disease transmission if proper onboarding protocols are not in place","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on digital modeling and visualization tools may lead to decreased physical collaboration, potentially hindering effective problem-solving and communication","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delays in project completion due to lockdown and high-risk personnel","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Communication challenges between off-site manager and on-site team","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on digital tools for construction coordination","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Site engineers and surveyors forced to work from home due to covid-19 lockdown rules","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High-risk personnel unwilling to risk their health to conduct critical surveying tasks on-site","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in managing project teams due to remote work","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct site investigations and health inspections","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conducting semi-structured interviews without proper safety measures may lead to the potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of purposive sampling technique based on ease of access may result in a biased sample selection and overlooking important perspectives.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Implementing a qualitative research methodology without considering the impact of covid-19 and the potential changes in data collection due to lockdown rules may lead to incomplete or inaccurate findings.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to people not adhering to lockdown rules","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on vulnerable populations, including the elderly and those with specific health conditions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential economic recession and financial collapse","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Construction projects involving large teams of contractors and subcontractors may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases such as covid-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global spread of covid-19 risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for the spread of contagious diseases due to increased infrastructure development and construction activities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential conflict of interest in research findings","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of accurate evidence and data
